reviews.review_msg: Really really great instructor! Dr. Graham is approachable and very helpful and makes sure that we understand the content. He is very fair and makes every class really engaging. Couldn't recommend more
Dave Chariandy is a hero. I would gladly fight beside him as a brother in arms.
Best class I've ever taken, he was an excellent prof and I would definately take more classes with him.

Professor Brook is friendly enough but her instructions in class are very vague and confusing and her responses to in class comments and answers to her questions are  discouraging - makes you feel less inclined to answer because she tends to shut you down or attempt to reword your answer into something you didn't intend.

This man was neither funny nor interesting. And his class was absolutely not informative. I would avoid him unless you A) Have no personal opinions or advanced knowledge concerning life and/or literature. B) Enjoy rambling, pointless lectures and lots of useless anecdotes. Oh, or C) Want a four-credit nap time.

An interesting character, which makes him an interesting lecturer. Discussions went weird and wonderfully places which took sometimes very obscure material and made it relatable. Some of his ideas seem bizarre, but if you pay attention, they actually tend to help overall comprehension. Definitely would recommend this course.
Paul is what I imagine God would be like in human form. Enough said. Take his class. Learn and be inspired.

This class kept me alive Summer semester. Sure, it was tough as h*ll and Smith doesn't give away marks for free -- you seriously have to earn your grade. But the persona he's created for teaching (which is clearly an act) is hilarious, and as long as you don't have thin skin, you'll appreciate his biting humor.

Dr. Smith genuinely cares about his students and he marks fair. His weakest point is his teaching. Despite having demonstrated a few times that he has the potential to teach better, most of  his lectures are poorly organized. As the course is very difficult, excellent organization is a must. I appreciate his unique personality and sense of humor.

Good teacher but places unfair expectations on students with reading and assignments.  The ?short papers? require a lot of time and effort.  Be prepared to waste hours of time reading a lot of gibberish.  This course was twice the amount of work compared to my other 300 level English class.  I was most annoyed that while he expects a lot, he does n

Jon gets a pretty bad rap. For the most part, I think people have a hard time telling when he's joking and when he's not, and he plays with that a little bit. He's a tough, but rather fair marker. He demands a LOT of reading and discussion, but overall I didn't find that anything he was asking of us was extremely difficult or unusually picky.
Literary Criticism = boring, at least to me. Thank goodness Carolyn was my Prof. She made the course tolerable with her great personality and her teaching style.

This guy reallys knows his stuff; however, if you don't want to put in the time and do the reading and research, don't take this course. Definitely a great mentor and encourages critical thinking and discussion. Managed to take a very dry subject and make it relateable. Only complaint: has a problem with names (tends to mix up people)

Kandice is a wonderful, caring professor. She was super accommodating and understanding in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and does a great job of explaining class material. Even though the material was dense and hard to get through sometimes, she incorporates mini activities and such that make it a lot more bearable. Would definitely recommend!

Dr. Linley goes out of her way to help students understand if they ask questions. She was super accessible outside of class and seemed like she really wanted people to succeed. The readings were pretty dense but she would give lots of information during lectures to help make the material more digestible.

Professor Linley is a genius. She is approachable and helpful and wants to see you succeed. Her assignments are fair and fun. She knows her theory like nobody's business. I think she's the best teacher I've ever had at SFU. And I'm in my fifth year.

Margaret is a very intelligent woman who has a passion for literature. She has some very unique insights. The reading in this class was insane! She's really approachable, and I got the feeling that she really wanted to help me succeed. I wish we had spent more time on the application of literary criticism, as I found the discussions often digressed
Really interesting course. Don't expect an easy A. I found Margaret really friendly and approachable, and her lectures made sense of texts that often read like gobbledegook
A very knowledgeable and approachable professor.

Not very personable...doesn't seem to bother remembering names, etc. Makes interesting texts seem dull. Went from A+ average on upper level english papers to a B in her class...which seemed to be her favourite grade, she gave it to everyone I talked to. Avoid her.
